name: Löübbach
description:
Introduction

Not a very interesting canyon. Nonetheless, the last 150m of elevation are made of a succesion of roughly 10 abseils, before that you walk a lot and abseil a few single obstacles.

Approach

Park at the exit of the canyon. Go up by cablecar (to Unterbäch), from which you can see how much you will walk in the canyon XD Go down through the village and then a affluent valley which probably has no water most of the time during the year.

Descent

Walk 500m through many trees, have 2 Waterfalls, walk another 1000m before you again abseil twice. Walk yet again 500m before you reach the interesting part of the canyon, which is made of roughly 10-15 rappels up to 20m.

Exit

Just follow the river for about 100m, that will get you immediatly to your car.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background

Some anchors are really old and not all are completely trustworthy.
